item.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18684)
item.content:encoded:
Twitter @leslieherod was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=leslieherod&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “'They beat police officers with Blue Lives Matter...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“'They beat police officers with Blue Lives Matter flags,' said Officer Harry Dunn. 'They fought us. They had Confederate flags in the U.S. Capitol.'”

HuffPost

“They beat police officers with Blue Lives Matter flags," said Officer Harry Dunn. "They fought us. They had Confederate flags in the U.S. Capitol."

huffpost.com

Police Officer Who Battled Capitol Mob Slams Racist Abuse From Rioters: 'Is This America?'

“They beat police officers with Blue Lives Matter flags," said Officer Harry Dunn. "They fought us. They had Confederate flags in the U.S. Capitol."“They beat police officers with Blue Lives Matter flags," said Officer Harry Dunn. "They fought us. They had Confederate flags in the U.S. Capitol."
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: Representative Leslie Herod shared a video from the playlist I Am Denver.I AM DENVER: Miss Edna WilliamsCity and County of Denver Government...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod shared a video from the playlist I Am Denver.I AM DENVER: Miss Edna WilliamsCity and County of Denver Government posted a video to playlist I Am Denver.

For Black History Month, we are taking time to recognize the history and achievements of the African American community in Denver. Here, we sit down with Miss E...dna Williams, a 2019 recipient of the Juanita Gray award, which honors African Americans who have demonstrated an outstanding commitment to the community. #IAmDenver
Learn more about Miss Edna at https://www.denvergov.org/…/88-year-old-denver-public-libra…

See More
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "Carroll Foy, a former public defender who served in the...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Carroll Foy, a former public defender who served in the Virginia House of Delegates from 2018 to 2020, is running on a platform that includes extending an eviction moratorium, changing zoning to balance density with affordable housing, addressing disparities in the quality of public education, and ensuring Virginia has a 100 percent net zero emissions standard as part of a broader climate change policy."

The Appeal

Jennifer Carroll Foy is a former public defender and state legislator who wants to overhaul school funding and extend an eviction moratorium until the end of 2022.

theappeal.org

Virginia Governor Candidate Says It’s Time To ‘Treat Poverty Like the Emergency It Is’

Jennifer Carroll Foy is a former public defender and state legislator who wants to overhaul school funding and extend an eviction moratorium until the end of 2022.Jennifer Carroll Foy is a former public defender and state legislator who wants to overhaul school funding and extend an eviction moratorium until the end of 2022.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "Halfway through the 2020-2021 flu season in Colorado, data...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Halfway through the 2020-2021 flu season in Colorado, data from CDPHE shows a dramatic drop in flu cases. Officials credit health mitigation efforts for keeping flu cases low."

CBS Denver

One unexpected outcome of the COVID-19 pandemic is that flu cases this season are almost completely nonexistent.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Flu Hospitalizations Are Down Nearly 100% In Colorado Halfway Through The Season

One unexpected outcome of the COVID-19 pandemic is that flu cases this season are almost completely nonexistent.One unexpected outcome of the COVID-19 pandemic is that flu cases this season are almost completely nonexistent.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "Aurora police and paramedics made substantial errors at...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Aurora police and paramedics made substantial errors at nearly every stage of their interaction with Elijah McClain and the detectives tasked with investigating the incident that led to the 23-year-old’s death stretched the truth to exonerate the officers involved, an independent investigation found."

The Denver Post

Aurora police officers did not have a legal basis to force Elijah McClain to stop walking, to frisk him or to use a chokehold on him, an independent investigation commissioned by the city found.

denverpost.com

Elijah McClain death: Aurora police didn’t have legal basis to stop, frisk or choke 23-year-old, investigation finds

Aurora police officers did not have a legal basis to force Elijah McClain to stop walking, to frisk him or to use a chokehold on him, an independent investigation commissioned by the city found.Aurora police officers did not have a legal basis to force Elijah McClain to stop walking, to frisk him or to use a chokehold on him, an independent investigation commissioned by the city found.

item.title: "The cloth masks will be manufactured and shipped at a cost...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The cloth masks will be manufactured and shipped at a cost of $86 million through existing funding with the Department of Health and Human Services.
According to Zients, the goal of the plan is to deliver masks to “people who may be in particular need of support.”

Denver7

The White House COVID-19 response team shared more info Wednesday about the Biden administration’s plan to send masks to Americans across the country.

thedenverchannel.com

Biden administration to deliver 25 million cloth masks to health centers, food pantries

The White House COVID-19 response team shared more info Wednesday about the Biden administration’s plan to send masks to Americans across the country.The White House COVID-19 response team shared more info Wednesday about the Biden administration’s plan to send masks to Americans across the country.

item.title: "Massachusetts ended a mandate requiring cops in schools....
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Massachusetts ended a mandate requiring cops in schools. Now advocates want Maryland and Florida, the remaining states with such laws, to follow suit and break the school-to-prison pipeline."

The Appeal

Massachusetts ended a mandate requiring cops in schools. Now advocates want Maryland and Florida, the remaining states with such laws, to follow suit.

theappeal.org

New Massachusetts Law Paves the Way for Police-Free Schools

Massachusetts ended a mandate requiring cops in schools. Now advocates want Maryland and Florida, the remaining states with such laws, to follow suit.Massachusetts ended a mandate requiring cops in schools. Now advocates want Maryland and Florida, the remaining states with such laws, to follow suit.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "In Minneapolis, lawmakers and advocates say Floyd’s...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"In Minneapolis, lawmakers and advocates say Floyd’s death is a rallying point in a years-long effort to transform policing in the city. The killing—a painful scar that will be revisited shortly when Chauvin, who was charged with murder and manslaughter, will be tried next month—has pressed the case for reforms, like diverting law enforcement funds to social programs and non-police alternatives. Still, efforts to implement such changes have faced challenges."

The Appeal

The police killing has accelerated a years-long effort by advocates and lawmakers to shift resources and money away from law enforcement.

theappeal.org

How George Floyd’s Death Is Pushing Minneapolis to Rethink Public Safety

The police killing has accelerated a years-long effort by advocates and lawmakers to shift resources and money away from law enforcement.The police killing has accelerated a years-long effort by advocates and lawmakers to shift resources and money away from law enforcement.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "Legislation will be introduced this year by state Rep....
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Legislation will be introduced this year by state Rep. Leslie Herod, with support from the State Patrol, reversing the current practice of canceling the driver’s license of anyone with outstanding court fees or fines. This results in the loss of auto insurance for 100,000 drivers each year, residents who still must drive to work or school — imposing a criminal penalty that puts the rest of us at risk over a civil dispute."

Colorado Politics

Miller Hudson: "Brian Boatright, chief justice of the Colorado Supreme Court, has invited the legislative and executive branches to undertake a joint investigation of disgraceful behavior reported within the judiciary

coloradopolitics.com

HUDSON | A thorough cleaning for Colorado courts

Miller Hudson: "Brian Boatright, chief justice of the Colorado Supreme Court, has invited the legislative and executive branches to undertake a joint investigation of disgraceful behavior reported within the judiciaryMiller Hudson: "Brian Boatright, chief justice of the Colorado Supreme Court, has invited the legislative and executive branches to undertake a joint investigation of disgraceful behavior reported within the judiciary

item.title: "We need to be in (elected offices) so we can make sure we...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"We need to be in (elected offices) so we can make sure we undo all of the harm and systemic discrimination that has been placed on our family – our peoples for generations" - State Representative Leslie Herod

The Guam Daily Post

More LGBTQ candidates for public office and more local policy reforms will be sought through Equality Guam, a new LGBTQ advocacy group supported by the island's lieutenant governor and public

postguam.com

LGBTQ leaders target 'systemic discrimination'

More LGBTQ candidates for public office and more local policy reforms will be sought through Equality Guam, a new LGBTQ advocacy group supported by the island's lieutenant governor and publicMore LGBTQ candidates for public office and more local policy reforms will be sought through Equality Guam, a new LGBTQ advocacy group supported by the island's lieutenant governor and public

item.title: "Elijah McClain's mother on Monday read the lengthy...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Elijah McClain's mother on Monday read the lengthy investigation about her son's death and "burst out in tears," saying the 157-page report proved Elijah shouldn't have been treated as a suspect when he was detained by Aurora police in August 2019, an incident that led to his death several days later."

Denver7

The mother of Elijah McClain read the lengthy investigation about her son's death Monday and

thedenverchannel.com

'They can't keep hiding': Elijah McClain's parents say new report exonerates him, exposes Aurora

The mother of Elijah McClain read the lengthy investigation about her son's death Monday andThe mother of Elijah McClain read the lengthy investigation about her son's death Monday and
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “The creation of the Charles Blackwood Endowed Memorial...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“The creation of the Charles Blackwood Endowed Memorial Scholarship is an institutional milestone and a powerful leadership move by the CU Anschutz Medical campus," said Rep. Leslie Herod of Denver, who chairs the influential caucus. "I am very proud to be a University of Colorado alum who has fought my entire career for critical state/private partnerships such as this one."

Herod pledged that she and her legislative colleagues "look forward to doing our part" to support a more equitable health care system in Colorado.”

Colorado Politics

The scholarship is named for the medical school's first Black graduate and will initially help at least four students of color, though the school intends to grow the endowment in

coloradopolitics.com

University of Colorado creates medical scholarships for Black students

The scholarship is named for the medical school's first Black graduate and will initially help at least four students of color, though the school intends to grow the endowment inThe scholarship is named for the medical school's first Black graduate and will initially help at least four students of color, though the school intends to grow the endowment in
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: How well do you know about the Colorado civil-rights pioneer,...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

How well do you know about the Colorado civil-rights pioneer, Barney Ford? Join me and countless others as we reinvigorate the legacy of this Coloradan real-life legend with Rocky Mountain PBS. The documentary premiere will be this Wednesday, February 24th at 7:00 PM MT!
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Numerous city councils and state legislatures are debating giving renters a right to counsel, which can make the difference between stability and catastrophe."

Most Tenants Facing Eviction Don’t Have a Right to an Attorney. Lawmakers Want to Change That

item.title: "While its future faced many obstacles in 2020, the...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"While its future faced many obstacles in 2020, the Tattered Cover Bookstore—which is under new ownership after it was sold in December—is working to reinvigorate its image with an initiative that resurrects a piece of Denver’s past."

5280 Magazine

Tattered Cover partners with Clara Villarosa, founder of Hue-Man Experience, to launch a consulting initiative within the indie bookstore.

5280.com

Tattered Cover, Clara Villarosa Partner to Bring Black Literature to Denver

Tattered Cover partners with Clara Villarosa, founder of Hue-Man Experience, to launch a consulting initiative within the indie bookstore.Tattered Cover partners with Clara Villarosa, founder of Hue-Man Experience, to launch a consulting initiative within the indie bookstore.

item.title: "City leaders in Aurora announced on Friday they expect to...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"City leaders in Aurora announced on Friday they expect to publicly release the results of an independent investigation into the death of Elijah McClain on Monday morning. The investigation is expected to be completed and delivered to them in the morning and then it will be made public immediately afterward."

CBS Denver

City leaders in Aurora expect to publicly release the results of an independent investigation into the death of Elijah McClain on Monday morning.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Results Of Aurora Independent Investigation Into Elijah McClain's Death Expected Monday Morning

City leaders in Aurora expect to publicly release the results of an independent investigation into the death of Elijah McClain on Monday morning.City leaders in Aurora expect to publicly release the results of an independent investigation into the death of Elijah McClain on Monday morning.

item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Aurora is getting a brand new rec center thanks to marijuana tax revenue. Crews broke ground on the new 62,000 square foot facility."

CBS Denver

Aurora is getting a brand new rec center thanks to marijuana tax revenue. Crews broke ground on the new 62,000 square foot facility.

denver.cbslocal.com

Marijuana Tax Revenue Helps Fund New Rec Center In Aurora

item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...

📸 Paul Miller Photography
Hair: Dornise LaTone Afhair
Styling: LILFRESHSAM
